result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy L. Evans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443

The Costs and fees of both Case 15CT458 and 15CM366, totaling, $3766.24,  are to to be paid in $50 per month installments, commencing on 8/29 /16 and on the 29th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 66 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail,with Huber privileges, concurrent to the sentence in 15CT458

--0 days credit for time already served given

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

The Court orders Mr. Evans to provide a DNA sample to designee
Concurrent with: the sentence in 15CT458

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CM366 and 15CT458 called together at 3:02pm [mo]
Defendant Timothy L. Evans in court, in custody with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Case 15CT458, Count #1 and Case 15CM366; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Count # of 15CT458

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Shock submits Victim Impact Statement

As to Case 15CT458:
On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve   7 months  in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence FORTHWITH
--Days credit for time already served: 27 days

--To pay fine of $1800+ costs= $3264 plus $59.24 for blood testing costs to FAPD= $3,323.24
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

As to Case 15CM366:
The Court sentences the Defendant to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail,with Huber privileges, concurrent to the sentence in 15CT458
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443

The Costs and fees of both Case 15CT458 and 15CM366, totaling, $3766.24,  are to to be paid in $50 per month installments, commencing on 8/29 /16 and on the 29th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 66 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court orders Mr. Evans to provide a DNA sample to designee
recess: 3:37pm

Cases 15CM366 and 15CT458 called together at 8:30am [mo]
Defendant Timothy L. Evans in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
Atty. Hagemann requests that this case be scheduled for Plea/Sentencing out 30 days.
recess: 8:31am--reconvene:8:32am [for scheduling]

The Clerk announces plea/sentencing date.
recess: 8:33am

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 1/29/16 at 3:00pm

Cases 15CT458 and 15CM366 called together at 2:06pm [mo]
Defendant Timothy L. Evans in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CT458 (State's Motion to Amend Criminal Complaint):
--no objection from Atty. Hagemann
--The Court grants the State's Motion to Amend the Criminal Complaint in case 15CT458
--Atty. Hagemann waives reading of the Amended Complaint
--Pleas of 'not guilty' entered as to the charged in the Amended Complaint
--The Court finds Probable Cause to exist within the Amended Criminal Complaint
--no demand for speedy trial 

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Evans. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

recess: 2:12pm

NEXT: Both Cases to Remain as Scheduled

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy L. Evans
Current: PO Box 311, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 10-07-2015)
Prior: W8719 Lake Lorraine Rd, Delavan, WI 53115
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 1:20pm. 
Defendant Timothy L. Evans appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond purposes only).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney De La Rosa acknowledges that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Mr. Evans verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct.
Right to counsel given.  
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.

The Court requires a $500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Hallie Miller or Jessica Grandt.  The Court provides an exception regarding the contact prohibition involving Hallie Miller: on a date after 10/7/15 Mr. Evans may go one time to the apartment of Hallie Miller at W8719 Lake Lorraine Road, Delavan address, accompanied by a police officer, to retrieve his personal belongings. 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, package houses 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician
--to take all prescription drugs only as prescribed
recess 1:25pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/28/15 at 3:40pm   (2) Status Conference on 12/15/15 at 8:30am.
